action.action-desc: Mr. Moran of Kansas (for himself and Mr. Latham) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to allow highly rural veterans enrolled in the health system of the Department of Veterans Affairs to receive covered health services through providers other than those of the Department, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rural Veterans Access to Care Act.

section.header: Enhanced contract care authority for health care needs of veterans in highly rural areas

subsection.header: Contract care for highly rural veterans
subsection.text: Section 1703 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: A highly rural veteran who is enrolled in the system of patient enrollment established under section 1705(a) of this title may elect to receive covered health services for which such veteran is eligible through a non-Department health-care provider. Such an election shall be made by submission to the Secretary of an application in accordance with such regulations as the Secretary prescribes. The Secretary shall authorize such services to be furnished to such veteran pursuant to contracting with such a provider to furnish such services to such veteran.
For purposes of this subsection, a highly rural veteran is one who—

subparagraph.text: resides in a location that is—

clause.text: more than 120 miles driving distance from the nearest Department health-care facility providing acute hospital care, if the veteran is seeking such care; or
more than 240 miles driving distance from the nearest Department health-care facility providing tertiary care, if the veteran is seeking such care; or

subparagraph.text: in the case of a veteran who resides in a location less than the distance indicated in clause (i), (ii), or (iii) of subparagraph (A), as applicable, experiences such hardship or other difficulties in travel to the nearest appropriate Department health-care facility that such travel is not in the best interest of the veteran, as determined by the Secretary pursuant to regulations prescribed for purposes of this subsection.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, a covered health service is any hospital care, medical service, rehabilitative service, or preventative health service authorized to be provided by the Secretary under this chapter or any other provision of law.
For purposes of this subsection, a health-care provider is any qualified entity or individual furnishing a covered health service.
In meeting the requirements of this subsection, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: consult with the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a partnership to coordinate care for rural veterans conducted at critical access hospitals, community health centers, and rural health clinics; and
expand the use of fee-basis care through which private hospitals, health-care facilities, and other third-party health-care providers are reimbursed.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall implement the amendment made by subsection (a) not later than October 1, 2008.

section.header: Authority of Department of Veterans Affairs pharmacies to dispense medications to highly rural veterans on prescriptions written by non-Department practitioners
section.text: Section 1712 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Subject to section 1722A of this title, the Secretary shall furnish to a highly rural veteran, as described in section 1703(e)(2) of this title, such drugs and medicines as may be ordered on prescription of a duly licensed physician in the treatment of any illness or injury of the veteran. Such drugs and medicines shall be furnished in the same manner and subject to the same conditions as apply to a prescription written by a Department physician.
